WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to write to shared storage, use the `MediaStore.createWriteRequest` intent.
Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.
issue.errorLine1: final SimpleDateFormat f = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");

Use of `scheduleAtFixedRate` is strongly discouraged because it can lead to unexpected behavior when Android processes become cached (tasks may unexpectedly execute hundreds or thousands of times in quick succession when a process changes from cached to uncached); prefer using `schedule`
Wakelocks should be released in `onPause`, not `onDestroy`

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.
